channel.title: hl2.exe crash on start Black Mesa
channel.description: Hi, guys! I have a problem on Windows 7 x64. Each time on start Black Mesa i see blinking screen after "loading screen". 5-6 blinkings and message box with "hl2.exe was crashed". I tried to set compatibility mode with Windows XP, restarts Steam and etc. Game was launched good 2 times. Another 99% starts was crashed :frowning: In attachment you can see hl2_*.mdmp files crash.zip (76.7 KB)

item.title: hl2.exe crash on start Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Syracuse
item.description:
Hi, I don’t know if this will help with your specific crash problem, and I know this is kinda late, but I’m just going to post my fix anyways. The problem with mine was a corrupted config file. For some reason, once in a blue moon or because of something you did to the configuration of your system/game the configuration file becomes corrupt. The game doesn’t know how to handle that, and just quits.

The fix: delete the configuration file. Once you do that, the game will recreate it, and you just need to re-input your preferred settings.

try this out, go to Black Mesa in the library, right click it, click on properties then click on ‘Set Launch Options’ in the text field put in this EXACTLY:

-dxlevel 9.0

It might work now…
